comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: Killed in early 1915 with his son and an accomplice.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
It says Gen. J. Carranza.  "J" reffers to Jesús Carranza brother of the First Chief of the Constitutionalist Army Venustiano Carranza who is depicted in this photo (white bearded [Americans nicknamed him "Whiskers"] man, wearing eye-glasses and gray hay, hands around knee) taken most likely on his trip to Sonora, during September 1913,
Venustiano Carranza as México's President, was overthrown and murdered in 1920 near a town of Puebla State called Tlaxcalaltongo.
Dr. Roberto Duarte
Plastic Surgeon

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thank  you Dr. Duarte for giving us his Gen. Carranza's first name. I will ask for our record to be updated.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: In The Sun, issue September 1rst. 1913 (The Library of Congress, Cronicling America), page 4, 1rst collumn, subtitle Attack on Torreón Planned, second paragraph it says: "Gen. Carranza has gone to Sonora vía Parral to secure ammunition" chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1913-09-01/ed-... Is it possible this picture reffers to that Sonora trip? He started at Piedras Negras, Coahuila (border to Eagle Pass, Tex.), most of the journey (about 1850 miles) was made on horseback, and arrived to Hermosillo (capital of Sonora State) on September 24, 1913. Roberto Duarte M D Plastic Surgeon

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: You can see a picture of Jesús Carranza in American Memory Home Digital ID txuruny 00180 hdl.loc.gov/loc.award/txuruny.00180 and compare the resemblance with his brother Venustiano You have a portrait of Venustiano in www.loc.gov/pictures/resource/ggbain.14619/ Roberto Duarte M D

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: This picture was published in El Paso Morning Times, issue Monday, August 11, 1913. texashistory.unt.edu/ark:/67531/metapth196531/m1/1/zoom/ That means the picture was taken before that date and can't be extended to 1915. Roberto Duarte M D

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Roberto Duarte:  Thank you for finding the publication date of this image in the El Paso Morning Times.  We will add it and the name of  Jesús Carranza  to the description.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/arden_loc] As I told you before, It is not Jesús Carranza, it rather is Venustiano Carranza (José Venustiano, Carranza (paternal last name, Garza maternal last name). es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venustiano_Carranza Best Regards Roberto Duarte M D

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: We'll add a note to the record, to clarify. Thanks!
